website_summaries.verdict: Mat doesn't rely on suction cups to give you nonslip protection.
pros: Mat offered in 2 sizes and multiple colors
You can fold this mat easily to store it
Full rubber construction contains drainage holes that remove water from the surface so it dries more quickly after use
No suction cups required, which could damage a refinished tub
cons: Primarily designed for textured tub surfaces

customer_reviews.title: It can rip along the fold lines.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this mat because it’s lightweight and stays where it’s put. I feel much safer in the tub now. Until just recently I’d have given it five stars. Unfortunately it started to rip along one of the fold lines and I never fold it. I simply lay it over the edge of the tub to dry. I feel for the price it should have lasted more than nine months.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Has lots of mold.
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use developed mold that is unable to come out.
customer_reviews.author: michael garcia

customer_reviews.title: No off gases
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use while bathi g our visiting grandson. We needed something without suction cups as we have a textured bottom on our tub. We wanted something larger than the cute baby ones as he moves around a lot. And we needed something heavy enough so it would not float in the water This mat checked all the boxes. It even folds up and fits back into the plastic pouch it came in for easy storage and portability. It didn't smell 'rubbery' like so many of them do it didn't smell 'rubbery' in the confined bathroom space
customer_reviews.author: Sharmcg

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't slip in textured tub
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a mat that won't slip in a texturized tub. This one lies flat and has a little texture on the bottom, but is heavy and feels solid. I tried to make it slip, but it doesn't. After use, I hang it on a stool and let it dry because I don't want it to mildew. I've done this with others and they still did, so I don't know if this will prevent it. To be continued.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: I love this mat
customer_reviews.text: I love this mat. I have a little two year old and I was struggling giving him baths because he would slip,slide and fall on his head. Regular bath mats didn't work because I have the textured tub so this was exactly what I was looking for. Now my little one can play in the tub all he wants without giving mommy a heart attack
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Keomany

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Very good mat for the shower but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Lies flat in the walk-in shower and folds up neatly to hang over a rack for drying. It does have drain holes in it, but I prefer to pick the mat up to let it dry out. The main problem is that it is now, after two months, tearing apart at the folds. See the photos I've provided. The mat has now fallen into 2 pieces and I expect it to totally fall apart. Would never waste my money on this mat again. It is a total waste of your money. Look for something else or rue the day you bought this.
customer_reviews.author: carpenter

customer_reviews.title: DEFINENTLY STAYS PUT ON TEXTURED SHOWER/TUB
customer_reviews.text: After trying many stick on products and shower mats that didn't work I finally tried this one. I'm so happy I did. It is the only one that lays flat and stays still on my textured shower floor. I hang it to dry after each use and it looks like new after several months of use. I will definitely order another one when I need it. I certainly recommend this mat for seniors who need more security than just a textured tub/shower floor surface. I find those surfaces get slick from shampoo and soap. This mat does not.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted 1 1/2 months
customer_reviews.text: This bath mat looks nice and is very functional, but unfortunately is also very fragile. Update: another large tear less than 24 hours after my last review. This thing is practically disintegrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: In my shower, it slips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was described as being for "use on Textured Tub! No Suction Cups Needed Anti- Slip Honeycomb Texture". My shower floor has one-inch tiles and we have been unable to find a mat that will stick to the floor. This sounded like it was what we needed; unfortunately, it slips more than other mats we've tried. Perhaps there is something we need to do to the floor since the instructions only refer to use in a tub, or maybe it's not designed for use in a shower stall. In any event, we cannot recommend this product since it may not perform as described.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Robin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for about a year, then fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: Sticks well without suction cups, doesn't slide, dries quick when you hang it. I'm very pleased with these bath mats for my refinished tub that I could not use suction cup bath mats for. That review was shortly after I purchased it. Now after a year it fell apart! Still, I am ordering another one since it is the only one of its kind for refinished tubs!
customer_reviews.author: mary boswell

customer_reviews.title: It really works on a textured finish fiberglass tub
customer_reviews.text: I am "top-heavy" and recently have had some scary slips and one fall in our fiberglass tub, even though it has a crinkly area on the bottom to supposedly reduce this. I thought no bath mat would work on that surface but this was perfect. It doesn't move around at all, and I can stand firm on it even after lathering up my feet. It's thinner than expected, but that's not a problem. I wish it was about 6" wider (it's 14" wide) and about 10" longer to cover more of the area, but I'm still happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: If you have a tub that previously had those built in non slip textures on the floor to prevent slipping and the little textures are worn and no longer working, you may have noticed that the standard tub mat with the suction cups don’t work and still slowly slide around. Those suction cups are made for a flat surfaces. This is your answer! My mom isn’t as steady on her feet anymore needs a little support. This doesn’t have the suction cups and it stays put! She loves it and it gives her and me peace of mind when she’s in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: EASIEST TO USE
customer_reviews.text: I sticks to my very slick, newly coated tub just fine; never had a problem. Easy to pick up, no yanking on the suction cups. It is about 2/3 the size of the floor of my tub, which is fine for me---others may need a bigger one. Drys fast when you hang it, and it isn't as heavy as others I've had. I got the rose color; it is a slightly softened raspberry/magenta---pretty and highly saturated. Should have gotten it sooner, but never liked the bath mats I've had before. Love this one and am thinking about buying another, so I don't have to worry about it going away...
customer_reviews.author: vee

customer_reviews.title: Treat it with tender loving care
customer_reviews.text: I have a FIBERGLASS tub I have found it near impossible to find a non slip map. Stumbled across this one and even through the bad reviews I thought I would give a try. I have been using this mat with very good results. I treat with care and it has lasted for months. I am even going to order one for backup. Follow the instructions and treat it well.
customer_reviews.author: Pwslvr

customer_reviews.title: sultan mat
customer_reviews.text: Since my bathtub was resurfaced this was the perfect mat for it. You must get it on the right side to have it not slide That is a matter of trying which one. Although there has been times it has slid alittle each way. I am aware of that and whatch it is not happening. It is a solid quality made mat that will last a long time if it is taken care of. The price is great for the quality. I would buy again although the mats with the suction cups are much more slip free.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L. Linz

customer_reviews.title: this is wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Oops - I think I left the wrong review for this product - my bad. I love this. This is the first time I have felt absolutely safe in my shower with a textured finish that is supposed to be non-slip. Suction mats do not work. And the finish, as is, definitely does not work. But this weighted mat is wonderful. It is not exactly the size for a shower - I wish there was a square option. But it was easy to cut the drain opening from the mat. I appreciate the safely this mat provides.
customer_reviews.author: cindy sue

customer_reviews.title: EASY to clean, no suction cups!  Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Specifically ordered this bath mat because it does not have suction cups that retain water and cause mildew. The mat surface is lightly textured - more so on the bottoms for grip, and is a breeze to clean! This is a heavier mat - the weight combined with the texture on the bottom keep it in place wonderfully. Folds up easily or can be laid over the edge of the tub. We ordered one to try in gray and it’s exactly as expected. Will be ordering a second one in a fun color for our kids’ bathroom! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bath mat of a mother's dream
customer_reviews.text: It is nearly impossible to find a bath mat for textured tubs. I had a kid's bath mat that I was using for my two-year-old that was driving me insane because the suction cups would never hold the bath mat down on the bottom of my textured tub. This one stays down easily, and clean up after a bath is much easier since I don't have to worry about mold growing in the groove of the suction cups. I am in love with this mat.
customer_reviews.author: E.C.B.

customer_reviews.title: Mat tears on folds.
customer_reviews.text: The length was good. It has never stayed down very well, but that was expected, because there is a texture on the bottom of tub. The biggest problem with this mat is it has torn twice at the folds, therefore, it is so short it is of no practical use.
customer_reviews.author: C J Merlen

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy mat for "non smooth" bath surface
customer_reviews.text: Update. About six month of use, and it still looks like new. I rinse it after every use (just water) and and hang over a bar to air dry. No mold, no damage, at all! This mat works great for the shower, to help with secure footing. It is heavy, and does not shift around. It provides a very secure surface for my senior family member to stand on. It is not very big, but works for what I need. I am aware some people say it will tear, but I rinse it an hang over the grab bar (not on a fold) so far a couple of months and it is still like new
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Its all broken, from regular use
customer_reviews.text: I use the mat to shower my baby, some days a move it from shower to shower. I wash it regularly. For me this is regular use. And as you see in the picture its all broken. I been using it only 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: sustiel

customer_reviews.title: It looked perfect. Then I unknowingly placed the usual suction cup ...
customer_reviews.text: I had recently painted an old cast iron tub with rustoleum's tile and tub paint. It looked perfect. Then I unknowingly placed the usual suction cup design bath mat in the tub. Uh oh. So lesson learned-- I should've used a weighted bath mat. This bath mat is perfect. Not too big nor too small for our tub. I take baths frequently and the mat stays in place and doesn't float to the top or anything. It's very durable. It protects our tub from getting scratches by our dog's toe nails. Wished I would've known and got this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Johns

customer_reviews.title: Great for textured tubs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a textured tub so finding a mat that worked with the tub was difficult. Suctioned stuck mats do not stick to textured tubs and the mats i found in store for textured tubs were not my style. This mat fit the look of my bathroom and its so easy to clean, i have super long hair and it gets stuck in the majority of bath mats ( and everywhere else) so i was extremely happy when i saw no strands got caught in the mat. The ability to fold it up is perfect for when i clean the tub. Only negative about it is, it slips around the tub sometimes and will fold up on itself.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the weaker areas where it folds.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well except it ended up tearing all over on the fold lines. In my case, it probably happened faster than usual because I hung it in the sun to let the rubber smell dissipate and then it was played on by my very active baby in the tub. I would imagine with repeated folding this would be common, though. I think if one were to hang it over the side of the tub or a thick bar instead of folding it, it might give five-star performance. Stayed put fine on my textured tub until it ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Nora French

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: I was so exciting when I found this, and so disappointed when I began using it. I bought it because it said it was non slip for reglazed tubs. NOPE!! When I felt how weighty it was I thought for sure it would be non slip. NOPE!! it looks nice and feels nice, but is NOT non slip.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: Great for textured tubs. Weighted. Works without suction.
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble finding a bath mat that would work with textured tub. Suction type mats won't work. And even though our new tub is textured, a little soap and it became very slippery. This mat changed that. We no longer need to worry about slipping. This mat doesn't use suction cups. It's design combined with being "weighted" minimizes the chance of moving when standing on it. We feel much more safe when using it. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great Mat for refinished or refurbished Bathtubs!
customer_reviews.text: Great for refurbished tubs! does not take the finish off the bottom of the tub as other mats have done. Nice & comfortable to stand on. cleans in the washer very well! I have to add an amendment to this review. This mat is good, however after washing and drying it in my washer and dryer several times, it has started to come apart at the folding seams. So I would recommend washing and drying this by hand. It tore in half and now I have to order another one, but I have learned from my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Young

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this bath mat! I have O.A. in both knees and I cannot have a mat that slips. All the cheaper ones do. This one is heavy enough not to float around and truly stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: April L.

customer_reviews.title: It works with textured bath tub however if I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: It works with textured bath tub however if I don't keep maintaining cleaning every month, the underneath will mold. A quick bleach and brush usually will keep the mat sticks to surgace.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Foldable, sturdy and easy cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Foldable! It won’t become too small, but easy to fold into 3-4 folds and store once dry. My husband gets annoyed that my long hair getting stuck underneath typical bath mats so he usually doesn’t like it. However, you can easily clean this one because there are no suction cups the hair will get stuck in. I’ve been using it for two months and it’s sturdy and stays clean with routine cleaning. I like how it’s heavy and sticks to the tub as well. This has definitely stopped me from potential slips!
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good mat for a textured tub
customer_reviews.text: This mat works great for my textured tub. I tried everything else and this is the only one I like. I just don’t like that the bottom of the mat (mine is a white mat) turns pinkish/brown. I always pick it up, rinse it off and hang it after use but it seems inevitable. I think the product packaging makes note of this too but I still don’t like that. Other than that it’s great. It stays down and is perfect for my kids in the bath and shower in that it’s non-slip.
customer_reviews.author: EAD

customer_reviews.title: Worst bath mat I have ever owned !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most unstable and slippery bath mat I have ever owned. It moves all over the bathtub. Not sure why so many positive reviews. Stick with the suction cups design mats instead.
customer_reviews.author: J. Aragon

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because I had my tub reglazed and they told me I cannot use chemical cleaners and suction cup mats on it. It worked well for 47 days then it started slipping. I don't know what caused this, I cleaned the tub and the underside of the mat but it still keeps on slipping which defeats the purpose. Maybe I'll try cleaning it again but for now it's slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job, but it gets dirty
customer_reviews.text: I liked this bath mat because it didn’t float in the tub like others did when they didn’t suction to the textured tub floor. It worked well and was comfortable to sit on for my daughter and myself, only problem was getting it clean. It wasn’t bad, but black mold accumulated in the grooves of the mat and I couldn’t get it to go away... finally I am throwing it out after about 6 months of use. I would recommend for its use, but the mold growing on it even though I cleaned it weekly didn’t help.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Works great on textured tubs
customer_reviews.text: Love this mat. Had one in our previous home. New home's tub has texture- not enough to prevent slippage, but just enough that suction cups stick, but still move. This mat stays put! Be sure to let it dry between uses, and regularly clean the honeycomb texture on the back side to avoid the "slime."
customer_reviews.author: EmCrossfits

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for textured bathtub!
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't realized that I had a textured surface in my bathtub and had ordered a bath mat with suction cups and found out it made the bathtub even more slippery. After searching for a non slip bathmat that could be used in a textured tub I found this as the nicest looking and with color choices. I really like it, heavy enough to stay in place and provide a secure non slip surface, and also attractive, a five on all counts.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: We have a shower stall, not a bath tub. The floor of the stall is textured, supposedly to keep you from slipping. After slipping around a few times I decided to purchase a bath mat but that didn't work either. I didn't know that mats with the suction cups would not work on the textured floor & a special mat specifically for textured floors had to be purchased. This mat stays in place, no slipping or sliding like I had with other mats. I finally found a mat that keeps me safe in the shower!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Conlin

customer_reviews.title: Still slips in the tub
customer_reviews.text: We have a refinished tub and this is the only product I have found that doesn't have suction cups. It heavy and substantial which I like. It works find for the adults in my house but it does tend to slip around under my child. Perhaps its because she is too light and more squirmy in the tub. I have to hold it down the edge of it when she's taking a bath to make sure she doesn't slip. This is still the best suction less option I have found though.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Finally safe in the tub
customer_reviews.text: After buying and giving away 3 bathmats, we have one that does not slip! Secure feeling. It stays put, right size for the shower, we have a fiberglass tub and nothing would stick to it. This one does. Yet easy to pick up and clean. Am so grateful to finally have a shower without holding the bar constantly. Great mat!
customer_reviews.author: easier

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work on my textured tub 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: We had been searching for a mat that would stick to our textured tub. After reading all the reviews, we thought we’d give it a try. . Don’t do it! Upon opening the package, I noticed there was a little hole in the mat. No worries, let’s see if it sticks? . . NOPE! It actually started to float in my tub once it filled with water. 🤦🏻‍♀️ I’ll be returning ASAP. If anyone knows of a good quality bath mat that will stick to a textured tub, please let me know. I’m at a loss as this is the 3rd bathmat that doesn’t work. 👎🏼
customer_reviews.author: Alicia J

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: This is the third bat tub mat I have tried. On the plus side it is really easy to clean. It is a good size for a standard tub and looks fine. On the minus side it does move around quite a bit. Not when you are standing on it, but it will slide around when you start the water before you step on it. For the price it is a solid item.
customer_reviews.author: David Raycroft

customer_reviews.title: Already has holes, mold and will slip out
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for about half a year. Light usage in my baby’s bathtub. I like that there is no odor. But that’s all that I like. It already has a hole in it!! And I hang it to dry every single night, but there’s still mold. And most importantly, it has slipped while my daughter was standing several times. She hit her head on the tub today thankfully she’s ok, but cried very hard. I don’t think she trusts this mat anymore. In the garbage it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L.

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that sticks to textured tubs
customer_reviews.text: We've had a lot of trouble in the past with bath mat liners with suction cups slipping so it's nice to have something that actually works and stays in place! It also doesn't seem to build up the gunk and stains that those other bathmats buildup and it doesn't have a lot of hard-to-clean nooks and crannies so even when you do clean it it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Albertson

customer_reviews.title: No slipping
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical about this item. We followed the directions and instructions in the package. This mat does not budge at all when I shower. However I believe that the fact that you are standing on the mat, and holding it down with your own weight, truly helps to keep it from moving. We do recommend this bathmat.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyPetLady

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and no moldy suction cups!
customer_reviews.text: I was so sick of bath mats with suction cups getting moldy and impossible to clean (even in the washer). I came across this mat and thought "how awesome!". It's PERFECT. And the weight keeps it in place. Easy to clean and move. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C. N. VanMeter

customer_reviews.title: Not good for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews that said this mat would stay on textured tubs. Turns out, it doesn’t suction or stick at all. I don’t think it would even work on a non textured tub. If you’re an adult and want something, maybe this could work, but not useful at all for my toddler. It also smelled awful and stunk up the bathroom. Amazon was good about refunding the item though.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Foldable design = design flaw
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bath mat for its good size, favorable reviews and the fact we could use it in a refinished (reglazed) bathtub without worrying about damage to the tub. It was stable, safe and we also liked the fact that it folds up into a compact strip in between uses. However, this design feature wound up being a problem: three months of careful use and it is already ripping along one of the folds. We will need to replace the mat as we can see that other rips await. Too bad!
customer_reviews.author: Nufsayd

customer_reviews.title: Claw Foot Tub's Answer
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for a claw foot tub where suction cups could not be used on the finish. However, it did stain fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: DFR

customer_reviews.title: HOLDS SECURE!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY bath mat we've found to work for our textured surface bathtub. This mat stays secure in our textured tub so we have confidence we won't slip. Never realized how challenging a textured bottom bathtub was; took us many years of buying wrong products with fear of slipping before we found this PERFECT Bath Mat! Holds secure! Extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my textured tub. Lays flat and doesn't slip at all! Have only had it a short time so we will see if it comes apart at the fold lines like other reviewers state. Lifts easily to dry and once laid back into the tub, it doesn't slide around. Using in my elderly father's bathroom. So far, I am really pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Animal House

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes it.
customer_reviews.text: Material is fairly light weight. Time will tell as far as durability is concerned. This size fit the tub bottom better than others and options for textured and reglazed tubs are very limited, so I chose this item. My wife says it works fine and she likes the color, so I am good with it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!  Doesn't float in shower and provides sense of security
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this mat. I haven't had it long enough to know about cleaning but can't imagine that would be a problem. When I finish using it I shake excess water off and hang it to dry. It adheres well to my textured tub and I feel absolutely safe in the shower. I have been taking baths rather than use this shower for 17 years because I was afraid of slipping. Now I am loving my shower!
customer_reviews.author: RuthieB

customer_reviews.title: The holes in the mat are very small other than that I liked it
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it laid in the shower but what I didn’t like was that I had to order two because the holes in the mat are so small the shower fills up with water and because we have a shower chair For my husband I Didn’t feel safe having him sit or stand in 2 to 3 inches of water so I put one on either side of the drain hole Now his chair sits on one Matt and he can stand on the other when needed
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for a few months, than the folds split and fell apart. Also it lightens in color on the edges, turned white! Looks awful and was a waste of money. And it was stored dry between uses... BAD PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good mat to protect restored bathtub finishes
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good bathtub mat that doesn't have suction cups, yet stays put on a refinished bathtub surface. We have a Miracle Method tub and it is very fragile, so this bathtub mat works well for us. The downside is that they barely last a year, the mat splits at the seams very easily, and after that isn't much good to stand on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kausler

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of feeling unsafe in my reglazed tub, so I paid $550 to have it stripped and redone with a non-slip surface. But I found that I could still slip on the new surface and it felt horrible and scratchy. I wish I had purchased this bath mat first. With the honeycomb surface and the weighted construction, it stays in place and feels much more comfortable. Finally, I can enjoy taking a bath again.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Collins

customer_reviews.title: It slips getting out of tub.  Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It slips when getting out of tub. I bought this bc we have a redone tub and can’t have sunction cups. I have broken a leg and an ankle in slippery tubs so I bought this hoping to stop this slipping. Well did not help. Almost broke another bone when it slipped as I was getting out of the tub
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as advertised but repurposed
customer_reviews.text: I placed this in the bathtub to prevent my father from slipping during shower time. It did not maintain the grip on the bathtub and became more of a hazard. However, I cut it up an landed up with 8 pieces to place under each leg of my two sofas to keep it from sliding on the wood floor when people sat on them, it worked fantastic! So no hard feelings, it just wasn't for my tub.
customer_reviews.author: Luz Garcia

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: BEST EVER. I’ve always struggled to find something that stuck in the tub and didn’t move around. I have two little kids and after 4 bath mats and 4 sets of adhesive stickers... they’ve met their match. Maybe they shouldn’t make them so well because I may never have to buy another one 😂... but I suggest this mat to all of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie Zajac

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: This mat slides everywhere it’s spilt in two places I’m stuck with what’s left cause i can’t return it
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old mat. My old bath mat had suction cups underneath, that would catch things and we're hard to clean. This mat is slick and heavy that it stays in place. It is super easy to clean and a perfect size! My favorite part is that it is easy to clean and that soap and other things don't stick to it. Definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Jrobert

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than original for same price
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the one I bought last year until it started to grow mold at the bottom (probably our fault). So I ordered a new one, same price but it's much smaller and I'm a little peeved about it. Same price for less product seems jipped to me.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Uher

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This started cracking and tearing at the thin areas between the square pads quickly. Finally after 11 months it broke in to 3 pieces. I would not recommend. However it did as advertised, and was not slippery on a textured surface tub bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Best Tile Shower Mat
customer_reviews.text: Does not slip on a tile shower floor. Gives great protection. Easy to place on floor; easy to pick up; easy to clean and store. Best part - no suction power which does not work on a tile shower floor - THIS ONE WORKS PERFECTLY TO KEEP YOU SAFE!
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie Fein

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for textured tubs
customer_reviews.text: This is the only bathmat we could find that works on our textured tub. We've bought a few others and had to return them because they don't seem to stick to our tub. This one works well because it doesn't have suction cups. The weight of the mat keeps it down on the bottom. I also really like how it comes in 2 different sizes. We chose the large and it covers our whole tub. It's perfect for bathing little ones. It is comfortable for them to sit on and keeps them from slipping when they stand. One thing I would suggest is removing it from the tub after each use because mold will grow underneath if you dont.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rubber mat
customer_reviews.text: This mat is very secured even if it does not cover all the way in the tub. It is easy to lift, fold or just lay over the edge of the tub. As to cleaning, I haven't had to do it yet since I have only owned it for less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Good mat for refinished tub
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mat for four weeks in a tub that was refinished by Miracle Method, and it works great. It doesn't slip and is comfortable to stand on. I leave it down on the tub all the time, except for cleaning. Once I week, I clean the tub and both sides of the mat with Green Works bathroom cleaner. So far there have been no problems with mold or stains.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Brown

customer_reviews.title: Saves a hurtful and dangerous fall
customer_reviews.text: Magnificent product. I use a tub/shower combination but always use the shower. The tub has a pubbly bottom so suction cups will not work. After one fall, my wife laid the law down--not again. Luckily I didn't get badly hurt. I ordered one of these mats and have been very pleased with it. Most importantly, my wife is pleased also. Before every shower, I wet the tub bottom and before turning the shower on, I step around on the mat to get it anchored. No slips!! After showering, I hang the mat on a grab bar for drying. It's ready the next time. I recommend this mat for anyone in my situation. Phil E
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Most Excllent
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is the best matte no slip and no suction cups with means no mildew I went though lots of different kinds of bath mattes and this is by far the best to keep clean. Now I have had it for 10 months and their is mildew tried to clean it with bleach and X14 but it will not come off.
customer_reviews.author: mrbigshot

customer_reviews.title: Tore Along Section Line after a Year's Use
customer_reviews.text: This bath mat initially worked very well on my textured bathtub. It wasn't cushy, but it did what it is supposed to do, i.e., prevent slipping. Unfortunately, it began to tear just less of one year of use. It tore along the lines of one of the sections (you can see the sections). It was used by only one person and it was treated as per instructions, i.e., after use it was removed from tub, rinsed and left to air dry (not folded). It was never put in a washer or misused in any way. I would have expected it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: BUYWISE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect: Since I refinished my tub I'm not supposed ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect: Since I refinished my tub I'm not supposed to use anything with suction cups and this mat is perfect. When I lifted it up after a shower there was no suction at all, and it didn't slip during the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe's Dad

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Like that it increases safety; dislike that there's water under it most of the time Will not have a good suction because it's a shower and the tile is not smooth Also, it is narrower than I thought Pretty color
customer_reviews.author: Faye Girsh

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based on the price and regret not spending the extra money for a better product. The mat does not stay put in the shower, and slides all over the place. It is not easy to clean, no matter how hard I try hair is always sticking to the top.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Best mat we've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This mat is perfect for those of us that hate the way other mats will get after a short time. Just pick up and fold over the shower rod after use and it has so far not exhibited any typical problems you eventually get with mats that sit in the bottom of the tub. Would buy again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe it took me 50 years to find a bathmat that doesn't slip! As someone who has had a fall and is conscious of bathroom safety this is the perfect fit. Bath mats you can get in the store have suction cups which never hold. This product is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Dale Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Was tan and broke in half in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice mat at first, except it was more of a tan color than white, which did not go with my bathroom. In less than a year it split in half. Also, I found that I felt safer without using the mat. Others in my home felt safer with it. I expected it to last longer. I guess you get what you pay for and this is cheap in design and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Walling

customer_reviews.title: This bath mat WITHOUT  suction cups is PERFECT for acrylic tubs
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low at stores near me for a mat for my acrylic tub/shower. It’s the only mat I found that doesn’t have suction cups. I am not able to use suction cups as it will destroy the new finish of my tub. I bought this and am so happy. I don’t feel like I’m going to fall anymore. It’s well made and does it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann B.

customer_reviews.title: Non Slip... But it doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I liked this mat for it's non-slip grip on the tub. But we fold it and store it off the tub floor so it won't mildew. The mat tends to tear along the pattern lines and only lasts about 5 months. I like it, but i find I have to replace it too often.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: It looks and works great. I hope it will last longer them the ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks and works great. I hope it will last longer them the previous one from another manufacture. That lasted 2 months and torn into eight pieces . This new one is a better quality and is not brittle. I good buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: patricia chan

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: I can see how other reviewers would have this rip. It suits our needs though. The fact that it folds is actually helpful in our shower. We have a narrow walk-in shower with mosaic tile floor. It is more difficult to find shower mats without suction cups. Glad we found this and made the purchase. Update: This mat didn't last more than a month before it started to split.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Tears after a couple months of use & impossible to keep clean.
customer_reviews.text: It tore after about two months, plus it was impossible to clean. If you forget to take it out just a couple of times (and picking it up causes it to tear), it gets terrible mildew stains. I scrubbed each panel with a toothbrush, but I couldn't get the stains out. I will be looking for a different solution to keep from slipping in my textured tub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Needed a non slip mat that did not have suction cups for my newly reglazed bathtub in our apartment. However havent had this long and its already ripping apart at one of the seams. Disappointing as this wasn't cheap for what it is,
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Not Meant for Comfort & Smells
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a bathmat that would suction to a textured bathtub for my toddler's bath time. I will say it suctioned nicely to the textured tub which is hard to find. However, it is very firm, and clearly meant for standing only-- It provides no comfort for my toddler who sits in the tub. Also, it has an extremely strong rubber smell and made my entire bathroom stink after about a week of having the mat open in the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Healey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very hopeful for this product to use in my kid's tub however, it does not stay in place. It slips beneath them when they are in the bath and I regret buying it. I was hopeful from the description but it absolutely does not perform.
customer_reviews.author: &jones7

customer_reviews.title: Great bath mat for slightly textured tubs
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how hard it was to find a bath mat without suctioned cups. We are renting a place and the tub is slightly textured but not enough to keep our toddler from slipping so we searched high and low for a non suctioned cups mat and this was the best budget friendly one. We have used this daily for months now and are so impressed! It has kept well, still looks great and is easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Regular Girl

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: This is a disaster waiting to happen. We had just had the Tub refinished, and did not want to damage it using standard tub mats. This was supposed to be a way to avoid it. Instead this stupid thing had zero suction, and started to literally rip apart. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Drakelb

customer_reviews.title: Only tub mat I can find for textured tub
customer_reviews.text: After an extended (online) search, this was the only bath mat I could find that did not have suction cups so I am glad they make these. It is heavy rubber and stays in place fairly well. The first one lasted a full year, it had started to come apart at the creases even though I never fold it.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste0818

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit slippery
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked reasonably well on my tub reglaze. I remove it after every use, rinse it off, store it to dry. It hasn’t shown any sign of damage in the 2 weeks I’ve had it. The tub is fine. But it’s not 100% stable like our suction cup one was. I get a bit nervous about using it.
customer_reviews.author: pencilskirt

customer_reviews.title: THE best tub mat for textured tubs
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made on Amazon. I have bought dozens of bathtub mats over the years, but those have had suction cups which do not stick to a textured tub floor. This bathtub mat does not move and is extra large. It is heavy but that prevents it slipping. We have had it several months and we have no issues with mildew or the pink water treatment we have here. This is a MUST for elderly.
customer_reviews.author: Joette

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great! I have a newly resurfaced tub. Had no idea you’re not supposed to put suction cups on that. This works great for me, doesn’t slip. I’m 150 lbs. Just don’t lean to the side or stand on one leg and try to grab something, be smart with weight distribution.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a textured tub and cannot use a bath mat with suction. This is perfect. It’s heavy enough that it does not float up. Plus it’s comfortable for my toddler to sit on. After each use, I set it on the side of the tub so water doesn’t sit under it. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Non skid
customer_reviews.text: Great for a non slip surface for a little one. I had a mom recommended it. I bought. And it’s great. Also can fold up and put away if needed. We are not every night bath people as it dries out the skin. So you can fold it up away after use
customer_reviews.author: DSwitch

customer_reviews.title: Don't Think Twice!
customer_reviews.text: OK. So I'm at the age that I do NOT want to fall in the shower, and my tub gets awfully slick even with a textured bottom. This thing WORKS! I feel really secure. The weight on this thing is great so it doesn't slide around and it doesn't float at all. Don't think twice if you have any safety concerns like I did. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Color faded
customer_reviews.text: Received it this week ... it’s heavy ... does what it claims it does ; However, color was a bit faded when it arrived. I did not bother to return because is seems functional and it is not easy to find non-slip pad for textured tub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I use this foldable mat in the tub to give my baby a bath. She cant stand in the tub yet so she sits on this and doesnt flop all over the tub. I didnt want a mat that sticks to the tub. We can fold this and take it out the tub anytime. With that said, while i like the mat it lasted only 6 months. I would still get again but just know it wont be long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: PDB

customer_reviews.title: Brand New...and Yellow?
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product for my reglazed bathtub as I can’t use any mats with suctions or it will ruin the paint. Washed it as directed and I noticed there is a lot of discoloring on the bottom side. Not sure if it’s like that or used...hopefully not the latter. The top edge is showing some yellowing too. Is anyone else’s like that too? Once washed I tried it out and as others say, it still moves a bit so you still have to be cautious with your kids bathing on it. Definitely better than not having one but hope it doesn’t get more yellow over time.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence N.

customer_reviews.title: This mat is worthless!
customer_reviews.text: This would not adhere to my textured tub, no matter how long or how hard I pressed on it. I put one foot in the tub and the mat slid all around. I bought it as a safety feature. My safety was assured by tossing it in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Book Buddy

customer_reviews.title: It Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a shower mat for "textured" surfaces. I had no idea what to expect but I wasn't disappointed. This mat has a textured bottom of it's own, but somehow, it stays right where it's put, it's comfortable and it doesn't slide around. Well worth the money. I'd def. recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: This mat doesn't slip or slide.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a way to make my shower safe for a long time. I have tried a lot of different mats and the all slip and actually make my shower more dangerous. I tried a roll on coating and it helped a little bit. This mat is very good, it stays put and is not slippery. They didn't have a size that fit my shower so I had to cut it and the water will not drain through it so I had to make a hole for the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Leland B. Korb

customer_reviews.title: Construction doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this product at first as it worked well in our textured tub and most importantly stayed put and did not slip around. For that reason, it's great for safety. However after a couple of months, it began to tear at the seams; not just one but at all of them. Really disappointed it did not last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Elena C.

product_meta.title: Sultan's Linens Foldable Non Slip Rubber Bath Mat for Textured Tub and Reglazed Tub (29-inch x 14-inch, Pink)
feature_bullets: Use on Textured Tub! No Suction Cups Needed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,657 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
